title: Palmer Penguins Tutorial
text:
Blog Post URL

In this blog post, I will be giving a short tutorial on how to make a simple data visualization of the “Palmer Penguins” data set. More specifically, I will be showing the penguins body mass by sex.


First, we load the necessary packages and data, as shown below.

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
data = "/Users/andrewhan/PIC16B/posts/Palmer Penguins/palmer_penguins.csv"
penguins = pd.read_csv(data)



Next, we will filter our data set to drop any entries with NaN values for their body mass and/or sex.


Using that filtered data, we will group the data based on those categories. Then we will plot the data using the matplotlib package. Using key words, we can choose the type of chart we want, as well as the colors. In this case, I went with a bar chart with blue and pink bars.


After adding the titles and labels, we can display our data visualization!

penguins_filtered = penguins.dropna(subset = ['Body Mass (g)', 'Sex'])

average_body_mass = penguins_filtered.groupby('Sex')['Body Mass (g)'].mean()

plt.figure(figsize=(8, 6))
average_body_mass.plot(kind='bar', color=['blue', 'pink'])
plt.title('Average Body Mass of Adelie Penguins by Sex')
plt.xlabel('Sex')
plt.ylabel('Average Body Mass (g)')
plt.xticks(rotation=0)
plt.show()
